title: I know Sylas isn't OP overall but what the actual fuck is that healing?
body: I just ignited one a bit ago ago and he just presses W and still gets half his health bar back. Is this the same design team that was calling healing anti-fun when the Soraka rework dropped?

replies.body: It sure was fun laning as tf against him. He misses q e autoes me 2 times and hits a w. I'm at 1/3 hp and he's 2/3 after missing all but a targeted spell. His w shouldn't also be an execute if he's going to get a massive heal on it as well. Put the execute on his q if he has to have it.
His W should not be point and click to begin with, it offers too much reward for how easy is to use.
Its not technically a point and click, its an auto-steroid.  It simply applies its effects to his next auto, similar to Nasus Q or Darius W

What? No it isn't.

It's just a spell that resets his AA timer. If it actually was an AA, it would apply his passive.

"Make it a skillshot" isn't a solution.

Has Ryze taught us nothing?

The limiting factor is that it has terrible range and requires one of you to be low to be at all useful.
Making it a skillshot just gives him another free dash to use as an escape though.

Twisted fate damage is hilariously low early. It would take 3-4 combos without items and him not healing to kill him due to how tanky and how much mobility he has. He can e when i hit the stun, then heal after my combo is done and outdamage me because he has sustain/shield. 

as sylas you act like he doesn't have a threat range. He doesn't need to max q or e in the matchup. He can max w and outdamage me while sustaining hard. That's the issue. In a 1v1, no matter how hard he messes up his combo, as long as he hits his w below 40% hp, he's going back up to 2/3 hp. 

Also comparing tf's stun to sylas. Sylas gets a knockup on his that has more range and can't be mitigated by tenacity. Tf stun is short range and mitigated by tenacity. 

Akali pre nerf had a non point click heal, but the point was sylas w is an execute too. He maxes it first into easy matchups and can't be shoved out of lane or killed without huge jungle pressure.

I think that Riot will start to even out Sylas, he is still fairly new and Riots in house balance testing has never been good.

For starters, I think that they should pick if he is going to have either A. strong damage or B. strong sustain/mitigation.  Because atm he excels in both.  He has a very strong shield with 90%AP scaling and a second cast which deals ok damage.  His W can be both an execute nuke (180 +55%AP or 270+82.5% if below 40%) and a huge self heal (190+35%AP or 285+52.5%AP if he is below 40%)

Large heals + large shields + large damage tend to make the champ problematic, as every time you think you have them, they mitigate you burst and heal back to full while chunking you.  For me personally, I'd like to see power taken from W+E and added to his Q

I gave a suggestion to turn the heal portion of Sylas's W scale with bonus HP along with the shield on his E. This way Sylas would need to carefully balance his build between damage, survivability, and mana more so then he does currently. This way just building something like a Ludens echo would get him mana and damage but his heal and shield would be lacking... ensuring he will die just as quickly as he can kill. Building something like a proto belt would give him a better heal with some dmg a bit earlier mind you but he wont be able to stick around thanks to needing mana. The best way to get all these would be a rod of ages, and that ensures he wont be such an issue for the 5 or so minutes it takes to start getting efficient.
 Point being he would need to decide what's more important early on and perhaps they could even adjust him to be stronger overall for it. Sadly that post fell into disinterest either way.

I think the bigger issue is how his kit interacts with the ults he steals. He can already be hard to kill on his own, but when he steals a sustain-oriented ult he literally becomes a raid boss.

{{champion:36}} {{champion:48}} When he steals their ults he becomes unkillable. He's already more mobile than they are, and does a lot more damage. 

Since I play a lot of Trundle he often steals my ult when I play against him. He then gains more in-combat sustain than me while also being more mobile and having higher damage. I'm basically punished for picking a champion with a sustain ult. With Mundo it's even worse, especially if Sylas goes tanky with IBG and Abyssal.
